parseLine

public void parseLine(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> line,
                      ErrorOut errorsFound,
                      SymbolTable symbolsFound,
                      ErrorTable errorIn,
                      InstructTable instructIn,
                      DirectiveTable directIn,
                      int lineCounter,
                      IntermediateFile intermediateFile)
Description copied from interface: SourceCodeParserInterface
parseLine parses one line of the tokenized source code at a time in order to check for syntactical correctness, errors, and prep for encoding.

Specified by:
parseLine in interface SourceCodeParserInterface
Parameters:
line - The tokenized line we are parsing.
errorsFound - An array of the errors we have found.
symbolsFound - An array of the symbols we have found.
errorIn - An imported table of all of the errors we have to work with.
instructIn - An imported table of all of the instructions we have to work with.
directIn - An imported table of all of the directives we have to work with.
lineCounter - The current line we are parsing
intermediateFile - The intermediate file we are writing to.
